ygData.subject: Re: Rogues
ygData.msgSnippet: Possible, but unlikely, Devilcat points out.  It s not coming in on a frequency that Cybertronian equipment can pick up. The Rouges get their technology

"Possible, but unlikely," Devilcat points out.  "It's not coming in 
on a frequency that Cybertronian equipment can pick up."

The Rouges get their technology from a variety of sources - they 
don't really care where they get their gear.  And if they can use 
equipment that the enemy is unfamiliar with, so much the better.  
There ARE other advanced races besides Transformers in the universe 
...

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "x_rauq_x" <x_rauq_x@y...> wrote:
> ooC: I guess I didn't reply to this. =p
> 
> -- Noir --
> 
> Noir nods as Devilcat explains the technology that the Rogues were 
> using. Pheonix had unknowingly become the perfect 
> spy. "Interesting..." Noir says, "The Predacons might discover the 
> data transmission eventually... is it possible for them to trace it 
> too our base?" Her metallic fingers drum once on the console, 
giving 
> off a slight sense that she was a bit worried.
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > Devilcat::
> > 
> > "Oh, just the visual feed from the trace program Torin hid in 
> > Phoenix's systems."  Devilcat knew that sooner or later, they 
> might 
> > lose possession of their pacifist prisoner - that's why the 
Rogues 
> > have had a plan B, which starts with keeping track of Phoenix's 
> > location and activities full-time ... and if necessary, 
overriding 
> > her systems and forcing her back into the fold.
> >
